refId.description:
A unique identifier for the query within the list of targets.
In server side expressions, the refId is used as a variable name to identify results.
By default, the UI will assign A->Z; however setting meaningful names may be useful.

hide.description:
true if query is disabled (ie should not be returned to the dashboard)
Note this does not always imply that the query should not be executed since
the results from a hidden query may be used as the input to other queries (SSE etc)

queryType.description:
Specify the query flavor
TODO make this required and give it a default

search.description: @deprecated Logfmt query to filter traces by their tags. Example: http.status_code=200 error=true

minDuration.description: @deprecated Define the minimum duration to select traces. Use duration format, for example: 1.2s, 100ms

maxDuration.description: @deprecated Define the maximum duration to select traces. Use duration format, for example: 1.2s, 100ms

serviceMapQuery.description: Filters to be included in a PromQL query to select data for the service graph. Example: {client="app",service="app"}

serviceMapIncludeNamespace.description: Use service.namespace in addition to service.name to uniquely identify a service.

limit.description: Defines the maximum number of traces that are returned from Tempo

spss.description: Defines the maximum number of spans per spanset that are returned from Tempo

groupBy.description: Filters that are used to query the metrics summary

datasource.description:
For mixed data sources the selected datasource is on the query level.
For non mixed scenarios this is undefined.
TODO find a better way to do this ^ that's friendly to schema
TODO this shouldn't be unknown but DataSourceRef | null

tableType.description: The type of the table that is used to display the search results

id.description: Uniquely identify the filter, will not be used in the query generation

tag.description: The tag for the search filter, for example: .http.status_code, .service.name, status

operator.description: The operator that connects the tag to the value, for example: =, >, !=, =~

value.description: The value for the search filter

valueType.description: The type of the value, used for example to check whether we need to wrap the value in quotes when generating the query

scope.description: The scope of the filter, can either be unscoped/all scopes, resource or span

TraceqlSearchScope.description: static fields are pre-set in the UI, dynamic fields are added by the user

SearchTableType.description: The type of the table that is used to display the search results

TempoQueryType.description: search = Loki search, nativeSearch = Tempo search for backwards compatibility

SearchStreamingState.description: The state of the TraceQL streaming search query
